dcterms:description: The Human Activity Recognition (HAR) dataset incorporates data collected from three sensors—accelerometer, gyroscope, and body sensors—deployed on 30 subjects engaged in six distinct activities.
dcterms:title: HAR (Human Activity Recognition)

dcterms:creator: Jennifer R Kwapisz
Gary M Weiss
Samuel A Moore
dcterms:description: The WIreless Sensor Data Mining (WISDM) dataset involves 36 subjects participating in activities similar to the HAR dataset, with additional challenges due to class distribution imbalances among different subjects.
dcterms:title: WISDM (WIreless Sensor Data Mining)

dcterms:creator: Allan Stisen
Henrik Blunck
Sourav Bhattacharya
Thor Siiger Prentow
Mikkel Baun Kjærgaard
Anind Dey
Tobias Sonne
Mads Møller Jensen
dcterms:description: The Heterogeneity Human Activity Recognition (HHAR) dataset was collected from 9 subjects using sensor readings from smartphones and smartwatches.
dcterms:title: HHAR (Heterogeneity Human Activity Recognition)

dcterms:creator: Ary L Goldberger
Luis AN Amaral
Leon Glass
Jeffrey M Hausdorff
Plamen Ch Ivanov
Roger G Mark
Joseph E Mietus

dcterms:description: The Sleep Stage Classification (SSC) problem aims to categorize electroencephalography (EEG) signals into five stages.
dcterms:title: SSC (Sleep Stage Classification)
